intro: Lagotis pallasii, commonly known as the Pallas's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lagotis pallasii is often found in tundra and mountain meadows, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
